name: analyst
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
B2 someone whose job is to study or examine something in detail, in order to discover or understand more about it and often to make predictions (= statements about what will happen in the future) relating to it : a financial/political/banking/industry analyst Some business analysts have warned of reduced profit margins. She is a market analyst with a major energy company. See also
systems analyst
cryptanalyst
someone who examines or treats people using psychoanalysis (= an attempt to examine a person's unconscious mind to discover the hidden causes of their emotional or mental problems): The only person I ever talked to about this was my analyst. He sees an analyst four times a week. Synonym
psychoanalyst
More examplesFewer examplesMost financial analysts have been surprised by the persistence of the recession.She is a senior education policy analyst at a Washington think tank.Many analysts are predicting an upswing in the economy.Analysts failed to predict the sudden drop in house prices.A large number of analysts are pessimistic about the future of the economy.
